contents: Article 5 (Accounting Classification) ① The Corporation's accounting is divided into general business accounting, welfare business accounting, national pension fund management accounting (hereinafter referred to as *fund accounting), and external entrusted business accounting. Revised August 26, 2021, ② General business accounting refers to income and expenses pursuant to Article 43 of the National Pension Act (hereinafter referred to as the *Act), and all transactions occurring in business other than accounting separately classified in paragraph 1. ③ Welfare project accounting refers to accounting that processes transactions occurring in welfare projects under Article 46 (1) of the Act. Revised August 26, 2021, ④ Fund accounting refers to accounting that processes transactions occurring in the management and operation of the fund pursuant to Article 102 (5) of the Act. Regulations regarding fund accounting shall be separately established with the approval of the Minister of Health and Welfare. Revised August 26, 2021, ⑤ Externally entrusted business accounting refers to accounting that processes transactions occurring in the entrusted business pursuant to Article 25, Paragraph 10 of the Act. Revised 2021. 8. 26., [Fully revised 2008. 12. 23.]
